title: Új külső az asztali böngésző legújabb frissítésével.
content: Tisztelt Firefox fejlesztők! Talán már több mint másfél évtizede használom a Mozilla termékeit, több platformon/operációs rendszeren (jelenleg win10). Ez a frissítés egy hatalmas csalódás, tekintettel arra, hogy ez az új design, illetve struktúrája a felhasználói felületnek (lapfülek elhelyezkedése, stb.) nem képezi integráns részét az operációs rendszerek felhasználói felületének. Nem tudom ki volt az a munkájához (ergonomia, felhasználhatóság) nem értő, aki ezt engedélyezte. Hogy juthat valakinek eszébe, egy olyan böngészőt ráerőltetni a felhasználókra, ami teljesen más logika alapján kezeli a lapokat, menüket funkciókat elrendezését tekintve, mint az az operációs rendszer amin használják. Lehet hogy a GTK környezetben linuxon ez még nagyjából elmegy, de windowson egy agyrém. miért kell szívatni a felhasználót? miért kell egy a rendszerbe nem illeszkedő designt néznem egész nap? Igen irritáló. Mi ez a szar? Ez egy böngésző, munkaeszköz, stb nem egy idióta játék, amit tökmindegy milyenre faragnak, mert úgy is csak játék és legtöbbször fullscreenben futtatják. Nekem olyan böngészőre lenne szükségem, ami integráns külsőt, és funkció/menü rendszert képez azzal a környezettel, ami a GUI-t jellemzi az adott operációs rendszeren, hogy az egységesítés hatékonyabbá tegye az életet. Hatalmas csalódást okoztak. Ez így használhatatlan szar (nem tudok finomabban fogalmazni, mert sokkal durvábbra gondolok mint amit ide írtam) valószínűleg az alapítványnál pár embernek más munka után kéne néznie. Kérdésem, hogy hogyan lehetne visszaváltani a régi felhasználói felületre, ami egységes egészet képezett a windowséval.
creator: szabojpeter

title: New tab page, shortcut images are too small
content:
My firefox just got updated and jesus christ, the images i put on my shortcuts are too small, everytime i watch there i feel like my eyes are forcing to see, it comes natural to my eyes to do that everytime

example: https://i.postimg.cc/XNzcrnjL/immagine.png

is there a way to get it like before? I mean, there is still the old space but the image got smaller and then all the space around the image is there but unused, i can't risk to get blind by using firefox :/
creator: BurroDiCacao

title: How to get tabs back below UI?
content:
Yesterday, Firefox updated and moved my tabs bar up to the top of the window, and got rid of the button that lets me move them to the bottom. They used to be below the bookmarks toolbar which is where I like them.

Last time I could right-click the Tabs bar and there was a button called 'Tabs on top' which I could disable, and the tabs moved back to the bottom. But they got rid of that and I can't find where it's gone.
creator: KA475

title: ERRATA VISIONE VIDEATE
content: Buongiorno, chiedo cortesemente l'aiuto di qualcuno: da alcuni mesi accade saltuariamente o con frequenza che all'apertura di una schermata apparia tutta o parzialmente verde (e quindi non si vede nulla), oppure in fase di scrittura alcune lettere appaiono o colorate di viola o mancanti (ma viene tutto recepito regolarmente), oppure che vi siano numerosi pixel neri che impediscono la visualizzazione completa. Oltretutto il comuter è diventato molto lento. Ho ripristinato firefox, avviato in via provvisoria, tolte le estensioni, disinstallato e reinstallato, cancellato cache, cronoligia, chiavi di registro, tutto senza esito. Ho utilizzato antivirus ma senza esito alcuno. Stante il problema non risco, a volte, a lavorare. Allego delle immagini, e se qualcuno può aiutrmi per favore. Grazie Mauro
creator: fm5601

Changes in about:config (keyword.enable = "false") does not bring a solution. The result is only that now I can not search at all. What could be the reason. (Windows 10, 64-bit, Firefox 89.0) Thanks for any help, Matthew

I've tried pretty much everything exept asking here and cleaning my laptop completely (re-installing Windows). Please tell me how to use our favorite browser again!

creator: arcovox

title: European Portuguese Pt_Pt not configured in Mozilla Firefox...
content: My Firefox web browser is configured to request pages in European Portuguese, namely by sending the HTTP Header: Accept-Language: pt,en;q=0.7,en-US;q=0.3 However, whenever accessing Mozilla web sites, the web server always choose to redirect to the page with the content in Brazilian Portuguese as can be confirmed looking also to the response HTTP header: localization: /pt-BR/ There are two errors, first the browser do not allow to add the Accept-Language as pt-PT so the server would make the correct judgement of the localization as a workaround since now W3C decided that pt stands for Portuguese from Portugal and all the other Portuguese speaking countries will have to add the capital letters of the respective country, meaning a Brazilian user should and currently can add the language Brazilian Portuguese as preferred language. Please kindly correct both the browser and the web site so the pages in European Portuguese can be seen at all.
creator: m.feliciano.m

title: Firefox 89 no linux e HTML5 de jogo online com problemas...

Olá!

Eu tenho o sistema operacional Linux Mint 20.1, interface Cinnamon. Essa semana, dia 1º de junho ( se não me engano), houve atualização do navegador juntamente com outras atualizações, como Kernel, driver de video da nVidia e outros aplicativos. Tem um jogo que eu jogo online chamado "Forge of Empires". Após a atualização da versão 88.0.1 para 89.0, passei a receber uma mensagem de erro que a página não consegue mais carregar adequadamente. title: FF89 made my tab bar invisible
content: As I say the tabs bar is open and you can see the desktop though it. There are no tabs there - clicking in the space does nothing. As I sought a fix for hours by disabling all add ons etc I did notice that when I opened "Customize Toolbar" that the tabs appear at the bottom of the page... I also noticed that if I click on a link a single tab appears down there and if I click a link in that page a new tab appears (the previous one disappears) and I can keep doing that. As I click the "X" on each to close it the one just before it reappears at the bottom of the page. I share all of this because it may offer clues. I, however, remain clueless. I hope I don't have to change browsers but I can't get anything done like this. Thank you for reading.
creator: mitch77

title: New tabs bar
content: The Firefox 89.0 with tabs bar is not working for me - taking way too much vertical space on the screen - any way to get rid of that bar?

title: Open bookmark in new tab/tab//Abrir marcador em novo separador/aba
content:
I would like to know if april is possible in a new tab/tab when i click on the bookmark in the bookmark bar. Thanks.


Gostaria de saber se é possível abril num novo separador/aba quando clico no marcador que está na barra de marcadores. Obrigado.
creator: nunescarneiro

title: Firefox v89 disaster visually
content:
This morning I got a message to install Firefox V89.0. Visually this was a disaster for me. The bookmark list is now vertically spaced much wider so I have to scroll up and down the list rather than point and click. The tabs at the top of the screen which used to be easy to differentiate now blur into one. Worse still there was no easy way to back out this upgrade while I found a workaround to correct these problems? I have spent a couple of hours now, researching, exporting bookmarks, uninstalling Firefox, restarting computer, re-installing the old version (v88), Importing bookmarks, finding the icons that were on the bookmarks have disappeared, kicking the cat (metaphorically speaking), reinstalling the new tab add-in, making sue auto update is OFF. Basically a huge pain.

Is there no easy way to rollback updates? especially when the user interface changes are so invasive?
creator: chris388

title: The new style for short cuts with its single obliquely positioned, incomplete (in some cases) capital letters is awful. Can it be changed?
content: I would like to know if the new style used for short-cuts (large, oblique, in some cases, capital letter can be changed. It's dreadful!
creator: s.goron

title: Bookmarks Menu - why does the 'Manage Bookmarks' entry appears twice?
content:
Thanks to Proton expanding my Bookmarks Menu off the bottom of the screen, I was re-arranging my bookmarks folders. While wondering which of my folders I had to prune, I noticed another in-built redundancy. The entry "Manage Bookmarks Ctrl+Shift+O" appears twice, at the top and the bottom of the menu. Incidentally the bottom entry is misaligned (Firefox v89 on Windows).

Is there a particular reasons for this duplication? Can I remove either of these entries?
creator: hutcheonke

title: Firefox89 fonts setting does't work
content: I have changed the font for Firefox89,but it only works on Troubleshoot Mode.The font can work on other browsers and former version of Firefox.

title: Restore or Change the address bar
content:
I don't have a problem with the new style or the new drop-down menu like everyone else seems to, it's just that now that the address bar has gotten slightly bigger my youtube will clip out the bottom of videos when in theatre mode whereas before it fit perfectly in frame of the browser.

So i was just wondering if there was some way to reduce it back to its original size, maybe a compact mode or setting i've missed, an extension or theme that can do that, changing the chromeUser, anything along those lines i could change to get this to happen?

title: Incorrect file extension when downloading

title: Vertical space between bookmark entries
content:
Since the latest update (to 89.0) my bookmark list literally exploded vertically. Before update the list took a bit more than half the screen size. Somehow the spacing inbetween the entries is now doubled (at least) and the list takes the entire screen and more (the last 4-5 i need to scroll for).

I found no option to adapt the grade of spacing and would like to have it reduced. Since the font size didnt change, there is no reason to expand the list that far. I might be 40+, but still could read as it was before. Whoever had this glorious idea was either bored or paid to annoy the users.

Screenshot attached (have no from before, sadly).

content: Hi. Why is Firefox so slow in my Ubuntu 20? Its www.speed-battle.com score is ~2.5 times worse as compared with Chrome, Brave, Opera, and Vivaldi. I tried other versions of Firefox both from Ubuntu Software and from manual downloading of its website; I opened and closed hardware accelerations options, the same. What are your suggestions?

title: PDF and Firefox
content:

I look in settings, and the application for PDF is set to Open in Firefox. I tried with Use Window application settings, but doesn`t work either. title: upgrade to FF89, request for security update for older versions.
content:
I stopped update to the new fancy Firefox, gonna stay with the 88.0.1 release (as I did with Thunderbird 68). Would be nice to have (just!) security update to previous versions instead of forced update to new clean features.

Those who are interested how to stop upgrade: put into your registry:

Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Mozilla\Firefox] "DisableAppUpdate"=dword:00000001

title: I really dislike the new UI
content:
This new UI is honestly baffling to a point where I dont understand how someone was paid to design this. No borders or divider between tabs, lots of wasted space, and aesthetic choices I really take issue with. Most notably in this regard the tab not being connected to the web page I'm on, but the way the browser looks when you have many tabs open just makes my head hurt. I get some people enjoy it, but I dont and I dont understand why I'm forced to use it instead of having an option to enable/disable it.

I really dislike the removal of functionality as well in order to make it more "streamlined."

"Fewer interruptions: Reduced number of alerts and messages, so you can browse with fewer distractions." I also don't understand this line directly from the update page. Why wouldn't I want to be notified of something? If I didn't want to be notified, I would close the tab or disable the notification. It is like they are creating problems to then solve with silly solutions when it was never a problem in the first place.

It genuinely feels like much control and decision making was taken away from the end user. I really enjoy firefox and have for years, but I am unsure that I am willing to continue using it after this update.

However, this appears to be a false positive, as now I cannot use Amazon's 'look inside' feature when I use the site. How do I check on what I have blocked and how do I unblock anything that has since been discovered to be a false positive?

title: What tis Going on with this new browser everything from the old one is now lost
content:
Where the hell did all the bookmarks go?

I have lost all my bookmarks for my work. I have lost all my bookmarks for my medical needs I have lost all my bookmarks for my family needs. I have lost all my bookmarks for my banking needs. I have lost all my bookmarks for my financial needs. I have lost all my bookmarks for my governmental agency needs. I have lost everything. I have lost all my email I have lost all my social contacts and links.

What's left in the so-called bookmark file is just a jumbled up list of bookmarks that I placed in the "other" category. My indexed and sorted bookmarks are all gone.

Everything was fine yesterday and for years before that, but worthless programmers have to change things all the damn time and screw everyone and everything up. Version 88, give me a break. If I have any problems with my financial, government, work, banks, or anything else as a result of this piece of crap update, I am going to bring Mozilla down to hell. Worthless programmers just trying to justify your anal existence by creating buggy updates so you can justify your anal existence.

Mozilla relies on volunteers to handle the complaints. They're too chicken to face their angry customers.

title: Remove Space Below Tab Bar
content:
thought l would ask a new question, though in part this relates to recent changes and a fix in another thread.

Namely having tabs below the bookmarks toolbar.

long story short there is about a tabs worth of space below my tabs as shown by the attached image, now l have tried tweaking the settings but about all lve managed to do is resize the tabs without touching the space below it and mess up other menus (though lve reset those changes), below lve pasted a copy of my userchrome file in the hopes l can get rid of the space (l did find another topic on the subject [[here|https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1276985]] but l didnt want to mess anything up by editing something l have little knowledge of).

/* Source file https://github.com/MrOtherGuy/firefox-csshacks/tree/master/chrome/tabs_on_bottom.css made available under Mozilla Public License v. 2.0 See the above repository for updates as well as full license text. */ /* Modify to change window drag space width */ /* Use tabs_on_bottom_menubar_on_top_patch.css if you have menubar permanently enabled and want it on top
  • /
/* IMPORTANT */ /* Get window_control_placeholder_support.css Window controls will be all wrong without it. Additionally on Linux, you may need to get: linux_gtk_window_control_patch.css
  • /
root{ --uc-titlebar-padding: 0px; }
@media (-moz-os-version: windows-win10){
root[sizemode="maximized"][tabsintitlebar]{ --uc-titlebar-padding: 8px }
}
  1. toolbar-menubar[autohide="true"] > .titlebar-buttonbox-container,
  2. TabsToolbar > .titlebar-buttonbox-container{
position: fixed; display: block; top: var(--uc-titlebar-padding,0px); right:0; height: 40px; } /* Mac specific. You should set that font-smoothing pref to true if you are on any platform where window controls are on left */ @supports -moz-bool-pref("layout.css.osx-font-smoothing.enabled"){
root{ --uc-titlebar-padding: 0px !important }
.titlebar-buttonbox-container{ left:0; right: unset !important; } }
root[uidensity="compact"] #TabsToolbar > .titlebar-buttonbox-container{ height: 32px }
  1. toolbar-menubar[inactive] > .titlebar-buttonbox-container{ opacity: 0 }
  1. navigator-toolbox{ padding-top: var(--uc-titlebar-padding,0px) !important; }
.titlebar-buttonbox-container > .titlebar-buttonbox{ height: 100%; }
  1. titlebar{
-moz-box-ordinal-group: 2; -moz-appearance: none !important; --tabs-navbar-shadow-size: 0px; } .titlebar-placeholder,
  1. TabsToolbar .titlebar-spacer{ display: none; }
/* Also hide the toolbox bottom border which isn't at bottom with this setup */
  1. navigator-toolbox::after{ display: none !important; }
@media (-moz-gtk-csd-close-button){ .titlebar-button{ -moz-box-orient: vertical } } /* These exist only for compatibility with autohide-tabstoolbar.css */ toolbox#navigator-toolbox > toolbar#nav-bar.browser-toolbar{ animation: none; }
  1. navigator-toolbox:hover #TabsToolbar{ animation: slidein ease-out 48ms 1 }
/* Source file https://github.com/MrOtherGuy/firefox-csshacks/tree/master/chrome/tabs_on_bottom_menubar_on_top_patch.css made available under Mozilla Public License v. 2.0 See the above repository for updates as well as full license text. */ /* Menubar on top patch - use with tabs_on_bottom.css */ /* Only really useful if menubar is ALWAYS visible */
root{ --uc-window-control-width: 0px !important }
  1. navigator-toolbox{ padding-top: calc(29px + var(--uc-titlebar-padding,0px)) !important }
  1. toolbar-menubar{
position: fixed; display: flex; top: var(--uc-titlebar-padding,0px); height: 29px; width: 100%; overflow: hidden; }
  1. toolbar-menubar > .titlebar-buttonbox-container{ height: 29px; order: 100; }
  1. toolbar-menubar > [flex]{ flex-grow: 100; }
  2. toolbar-menubar > spacer[flex]{
order: 99; flex-grow: 1; min-width: var(--uc-window-drag-space-width,20px); }
  1. toolbar-menubar .titlebar-button{ padding: 2px 17px !important; }
  1. toolbar-menubar .toolbarbutton-1 { --toolbarbutton-inner-padding: 3px }
/* TABS: height */ *|*:root { --tab-toolbar-navbar-overlap: 0px !important; --tab-min-height: 25px !important; --tab-min-width: 80px !important; } --tab-min-width: 80px !important;
  1. tabbrowser-tabs {
width: 100vw !important; }
  1. main-window:not([chromehidden*="toolbar"]) #navigator-toolbox {padding-bottom: var(--tab-min-height) !important;}
.tab-background { border-radius: 8px 8px 0px 0px !important; border-image: none !important; } .tab-line { display: none; } .tab-close-button { color: red!important; } /*** Proton Tabs Tweaks ***/ /* Adjust tab corner shape, optionally remove space below tabs */
  1. tabbrowser-tabs {
--user-tab-rounding: 4px; } @media (-moz-proton) { .tab-background { border-radius: var(--user-tab-rounding) var(--user-tab-rounding) 0px 0px !important; margin-block: 1px 0 !important; } } /* Inactive tabs: Outline style */ @media (-moz-proton) { .tab-background:not([selected=true]):not([multiselected=true]) { border: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, .20) !important; border-bottom-color: transparent !important; } /* For dark backgrounds */ [brighttext="true"] .tab-background:not([selected=true]):not([multiselected=true]) { border: 1px solid var(--lwt-selected-tab-background-color, rgba(255, 255, 255, .20)) !important; } /* Remove extra padding between tabs */ .tabbrowser-tab { padding-left: 0 !important; } } /* Tweak Options as of 5/30/2021; Generated Thu Jun 03 2021 23:25:50 GMT+0100 (British Summer Time) */

title: How do I set firefox to never restore sessions
content:
Firefox is frequently slow to start, takes 3 to 5 minutes or more and then says can not restore session.

I never want my session restored. I searched for 'never restore previous session' and the answers make my head hurt, not really understandable to me from square one. I am 63 but fairly tech savoy (an architect). Can someone please give me an answer that I can follow? For instance it took me quite a while to figure out what a 3 bar menu was. I heard it called a hamburger menu. but when I clicked the hamburger menu and clicked 'options' I did not find the next word in the thread below. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1262464#question-reply

title: How do I manage the sound Icon in tabs?
content:
With the latest update a lot of ease-of-use has gone away. Include is the fact that tabs that are playing sound only show an icon when I hover the mouse over them. I can not seem to about:config to get the sound icon to remain, despite changing the setting. This means if multiple tabs are playing I have to search all the tabs individually. It also means I cannot quickly switch to the desired tabs muting and unmuting as I prefer.

While this is a specific problem which I hope you can solve readily, it is a part of a pattern I have seen over some of the more recent updates, where useful features are removed in favor of aesthetics. It was this very mistake that lead me to leave internet explorer for firefox. Leave us the ability to turn on and off what we like, instead of forcing us to accept whatever you think is the trend.
